greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: If n = Product (p_j^k_j) then a(n) = Sum (k_j >= 2, p_j^k_j).
comment: Sum of unitary, proper prime power divisors of n.
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..16384
Index entries for sequences related to sums of divisors
formula: a(n) = Sum_{d|n, d = p^k, p prime, k >= 2, gcd(d, n/d) = 1} d.
program: from sympy import primefactors, isprime, gcd, divisors
def a(n): return sum(d for d in divisors(n) if gcd(d, n//d)==1 and len(primefactors(d))==1 and not isprime(d))
print([a(n) for n in range(1, 109)]) # _Indranil Ghosh_, Aug 02 2017
(PARI) A286875(n) = { my(f=factor(n)); for (i=1, #f~, if(f[i, 2] < 2, f[i, 1] = 0)); vecsum(vector(#f~,i,f[i,1]^f[i,2])); }; \\ _Antti Karttunen_, Oct 07 2017
results.author: _Ilya Gutkovskiy_, Aug 02 2017
